hook: If your game plan involves driving down Tasman Drive this week, you aren't driving to the Super Bowl—you're driving into a concrete wall.

sections.title: The Phase III Lockdown
key_points: Define the 'Hard Zone' closure scope and timeline.
Explain why GPS apps cannot be trusted for this specific closure.
Describe the physical reality of the K-rail barriers.
stats_facts: Tasman Drive is fully closed between Convention Center and Great America Parkway (Jan 28 - Feb 13).
Phase III security barriers (concrete K-rails) were installed last night.
GPS apps often show the road as 'slow' rather than 'closed' until you are trapped.
sections.transition: Once you realize you can't drive through, your instinct is to call a rideshare, but that is exactly where the second trap lies.

sections.title: The Rideshare Mirage
key_points: Highlight the inconvenience of the official drop-off point.
Explain why drivers are cancelling rides into the zone.
Contrast the official wait times with walking times.
stats_facts: Official rideshare drop-off has moved to Red Lot 7, a 25-minute walk to the gates.
Drivers are cancelling rides with 'Soft Zone' pins to avoid getting stuck in checkpoints.
Wait times in the official queue are averaging 45 minutes.
sections.transition: Forget the official lots and the frustrated drivers; to beat the perimeter, you need to use the 'Mercado Hack'.

sections.title: The Mercado Hack
key_points: Identify the specific shopping center to use as a staging ground.
Explain the route from Mission College Blvd.
Detail why this bypasses the main gridlock nodes.
stats_facts: Mercado Shopping Center allows for 'unofficial' drop-offs outside the security cordon.
The walk from Mercado takes 18 minutes, which is time-invariant.
This route completely avoids the Great America Parkway standstill.
sections.transition: Once you are on foot at Mercado, you connect to the one piece of infrastructure that traffic control can't shut down.

sections.title: The Creek Trail Bypass
key_points: Describe the San Tomas Aquino Creek Trail route.
Explain how it cuts through the security perimeter.
Mention the VTA exception for context.
stats_facts: The trail runs below street level, bypassing the 'Tasman Crush' entirely.
VTA Light Rail is the *only* motorized vehicle allowed to cross the 'Hard Zone'.
Walking the trail provides direct access to Gate C.
sections.transition: Getting in is half the battle, but the real pro move is knowing how to escape when the game ends.

sections.title: The Exit Strategy
key_points: Warn against using official shuttles post-game.
Explain the surge pricing geofence advantage.
Reiterate the duration of the lockdown.
stats_facts: Official Fan Express Shuttles sit in the same traffic as general parking.
Walking south to Mercado puts you outside the primary surge pricing geofence.
Tasman remains a fortress until Feb 13—there is no 'waiting it out'.
sections.transition: The map you used last year is worthless; trust the physical barriers, trust the trail, and trust your feet.
